review: I can honestly only give this device a 3 star rating due to its poor portability. The remote is absolutely ESSENTIAL to using this device. If you lose/forget the remote and you're on a trip, the Fire TV stick is worthless. Why? Because you cannot join a new wifi network without the remote.  In order to communicate with the device and set up a new wifi connection (at a hotel for example), you must have the remote. The Android/iOS app is not capable of talking to your Fire TV stick unless it's already connected to the wifi. But if you don't have the remote...you cannot connect to the wifi. See the problem here?All in all, it works if you plan to plug it in at home and just leave it there. My goal with the device was to take it over to friends' house and use it as a portable player. Requiring me to constantly remember the remote makes that far less appetizing. For portability, go Chromecast.
